item.title: Companies Need to Stop Making Phones for Professional Photographers Because There Aren’t Any Takers
item.description: Can smartphones replace professional cameras? That question has stirred up one of the more prevalent and polarizing discussions in the phone industry the past few years. And it’s certainly understandable. After all, smartphones did put point-and-shoot cameras out of existence. So when companies began bringing bigger sensors and a much more versatile set of hardware to these tiny pocketable devices, many did feel they might eventually supersede dedicated cameras as well.

item.title: Hear Hear
item.description: New Beginnings This is the first post. I’m sure you’ve come across these before. But that doesn’t mean it’s simply a placeholder. On the contrary, I take first posts rather seriously. For me, this piece is a harbinger to the forthcoming good stuff. The question is what will I publish here? Honestly, I don’t have a specific answer. Most likely, this personal blog will be home to everything that comes to my mind which I won’t be able to pitch to other publications.
